name: spcdvw
params: setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

stmt.origin: mpsyl(w0, wi(wal(s0, w1), w2), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wi(w1, w2))), wcel(c0, c1))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wi(wal(s0, w1), w2))
-| wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wi(w1, w2)))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c1))
-| wi(wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wi(w1, w2))), wi(wcel(c0, c1), wi(wal(s0, w1), w2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wi(wal(s0, w1), w2))
-| wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wi(w1, w2)))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c1))
-| wi(wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wi(w1, w2))), wi(wcel(c0, c1), wi(wal(s0, w1), w2)))

-| wi(wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wi(w1, w2))), wi(wcel(c0, c1), wi(wal(s0, w1), w2)))
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wi(w1, w2))

body.origin:
|- wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wi(w1, w2))
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w2))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wi(wal(s0, w1), w2))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c1))
-| wi(wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wi(w1, w2))), wi(wcel(c0, c1), wi(wal(s0, w1), w2)))
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w2))

body.origin:

-| wnfc(s0, c0)

|- wi(w0, wi(wal(s0, w1), w2))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c1))
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w2))
-| wnfc(s0, c0)
-| diffsw(s0, w2)

|- wi(w0, wi(wal(s0, w1), w2))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c1))
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w2))
-| diffsw(s0, w2)

comment: A version of ~ spcdv where ` ps ` and ` ch ` are direct substitutions of each other. This theorem is useful because it does not require ` ph ` and ` x ` to be distinct variables. (Contributed by Emmett Weisz, 12-Apr-2020.)
